SEARCH
Package io.brane.core.builder

Class LegacyBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.brane.core.builder.LegacyBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
TxBuilder<LegacyBuilder>
public final class LegacyBuilder extends Object implements TxBuilder<LegacyBuilder>
Builder for legacy (pre-EIP-1559) transactions with a single gas price.

Legacy transactions use a single gasPrice field instead of the EIP-1559 maxFeePerGas and maxPriorityFeePerGas fields.

Example: 


 TransactionRequest tx = TxBuilder.legacy()
     .from(sender)
     .to(recipient)
     .value(Wei.ether("1"))
     .gasPrice(Wei.gwei(50))
     .gasLimit(21000)
     .build();

Thread Safety: This builder is not thread-safe. Each thread should use its own builder instance. The build() method creates an immutable TransactionRequest that is safe to share across threads.

Since:
0.1.0-alpha
See Also:

    • from

      public LegacyBuilder from(Address address)
      Description copied from interface: TxBuilder
      Sets the sender address.

      The sender address is required for all transactions. Calling TxBuilder.build() without setting a from address will result in incomplete transaction data that cannot be signed or submitted.

      Specified by:
      from in interface TxBuilder<LegacyBuilder>
      Parameters:
      address - the sender address (must not be null)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • gasPrice

      public LegacyBuilder gasPrice(Wei gasPrice)
      Sets the gas price for the transaction.

      This is the price per gas unit that the sender is willing to pay. Higher gas prices increase the likelihood of faster transaction inclusion.

      Parameters:
      gasPrice - the gas price in wei
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
